title.value: Real-time simulation of viscoelastic tissue behavior with physics-guided deep learning
title.justification: This is the title of the paper as stated at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: Real-time simulation of viscoelastic tissue behavior with physics-guided deep learning

extractions.description: The paper proposes a deep learning method for predicting the displacement fields of soft tissues with viscoelastic properties to improve real-time applications like virtual reality surgical training. It introduces a physics-guided loss function and combines convolutional (CNN) and recurrent layers (LSTM) to improve prediction accuracy and generalization, comparing its performance with traditional FEM techniques and existing deep learning models.

type.justification: The paper describes experiments and results obtained from implementing the proposed deep learning method, indicating empirical research work.
type.quote: Our experiments have demonstrated that physics-guided deep learning is a viable solution for speeding up FEM simulations.

name.justification: The paper utilizes Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), a common technique in the field of computer vision, to perform simulations of tissue deformation.
name.quote: Recently, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs), a class of machine learning methods, have been used to speed up FEM simulations.

name.justification: The primary novelty in the paper is the introduction of a physics-guided loss function to improve the model prediction accuracy for viscoelastic tissue behavior.
name.quote: Combining physical laws with deep learning, referred to as physics-guided deep learning, has received considerable attention in recent years.

name.justification: The application domain focuses on simulating tissue behavior for virtual reality surgical training, making medical simulation a significant sub-field.
name.quote: Virtual reality simulators thus enable trainees to practice on a variety of educational scenarios as well as to enable the definition of new training metrics and applications (e.g. remote training).

name.justification: The paper describes a deep learning model that combines Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) for spatial feature extraction and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks for temporal sequence modeling.
name.quote: Our proposed deep neural network model combines Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) and Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM).

is_contributed.justification: The CNN-LSTM model is a newly proposed deep learning architecture in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: This work proposes, for the first time to the authors’ knowledge, a deep learning method for predicting displacement fields of soft tissues with viscoelastic properties.

is_executed.justification: The model execution process involves training and inference using computational resources, indicating execution.
is_executed.quote: All the experiments have been done on a personal computer with an Intel Core i7 (3.40 GHz) and an Nvidia Geforce RTX 2080 with 11 GB of video RAM.

is_compared.justification: The performance of the CNN-LSTM model is compared against other methods like linear regression and traditional CNN models.
is_compared.quote: Herein, our proposed technique has been compared with two different techniques for the prediction of tissue deformation from the external force: linear regression (as a baseline model) and a previously introduced Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model.

referenced_paper_title.value: U-Net: convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The CNN component of the model is based on the U-Net architecture, as referenced by Ronneberger et al.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Ronneberger, O., Fischer, P., Brox, T., 2015. U-Net: convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation. Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention, Springer, LNCS, 9351, 234–241.

name.justification: The paper includes the use of a CNN model based on the U-Net architecture for comparison purposes.
name.quote: The selected reference convolutional neural network is based on a U-Net architecture and is represented in Figure 1.

is_contributed.justification: The CNN U-Net model is not a contribution of this paper, as it was introduced in previous research.
is_contributed.quote: U-Net, a neural network architecture based on convolutional layers, [22] has already been experimented successfully for the simulation of simple hyperelastic materials [21].

is_executed.justification: The execution of the CNN U-Net model is described in the experiments section.
is_executed.quote: Models have been implemented in TensorFlow, and the source code is available at: https://github.com/Mkarami3/UNet_FEM.

is_compared.justification: The performance of the CNN U-Net model is compared against the proposed CNN-LSTM model and baseline methods.
is_compared.quote: Herein, our proposed technique has been compared with two different techniques for the prediction of tissue deformation from the external force: linear regression (as a baseline model) and a previously introduced Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model.

referenced_paper_title.value: U-Net: convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The CNN U-Net model is based on the architecture introduced by Ronneberger et al. in their referenced paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Ronneberger, O., Fischer, P., Brox, T., 2015. U-Net: convolutional networks for biomedical image segmentation. Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention, Springer, LNCS, 9351, 234–241.

name.justification: The FEM simulation dataset created using the NeuroTouch virtual reality neurosurgery simulator is utilized to train and evaluate the models.
name.quote: The deep learning models are trained on a set of FEM datasets generated from a commercial-grade simulator.

referenced_paper_title.value: NeuroTouch: A Physics-Based Virtual Simulator for Cranial Microneurosurgery Training
referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is generated using the NeuroTouch neurosurgery simulator, referring to the work by Delorme et al.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A virtual reality neurosurgery simulator with haptic feedback2 [1, 2], (Figure 2) was used to illustrate the applicability of the proposed method for fast viscoelastic tissue displacement simulation.

name.justification: The paper mentions the implementation of models using TensorFlow.
name.quote: The models have been implemented in TensorFlow, and the source code is available at: https://github.com/Mkarami3/UNet_FEM.

referenced_paper_title.value: TensorFlow: Large-Scale Machine Learning on Heterogeneous Distributed Systems
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the original paper introducing TensorFlow, specifying its use for large-scale machine learning implementations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The models have been implemented in TensorFlow, and the source code is available at: https://github.com/Mkarami3/UNet_FEM.
